snippet.title: Wreckage of US Marines Corp heli-plane found off Queensland
snippet.content:
The wreckage of a US Marines heli-plane that crashed during a training exercise north of Rockhampton on Saturday has been found. Australian Defence Minister Marise Payne confirmed an Australian Navy ship had found the missing MV-22 Osprey overnight on Sunday, submerged in waters off Queensland.Photo: US ARMY "The Australian Defence Force has commenced its support to US-led recovery operations following the MV-22 Osprey incident in Shoalwater Bay on Saturday," the statement said.
"Royal Australian Navy survey ship HMAS Melville arrived to Shoalwater Bay overnight. Shortly after commencing survey operations in the area, the submerged aircraft was located." Navy divers are now working with the crew of HMAS Melville at the wreckage site, using remotely operated underwater vehicles. The government would offer further support as required, the statement said. More to come
